definition: variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]

sentences.english: The dolls symbolize that children may keep out of disasters and bad lucks, growing up happily.
sentences.chinese: 象征孩子摆脱恶运和灾难，将来能够快乐成长。

sentences.english: An ill marriage is a spring of ill fortune.
sentences.chinese: 不良的婚姻是恶运的来源。

sentences.english: That foul mouth stands there bringing more ill fortune with his blasphemies.
sentences.chinese: 那一张臭嘴站在那儿满嘴喷粪，只能带来更多恶运。

sentences.english: Misfortune hounds the sinner, while the upright abound in good fortune.
sentences.chinese: 恶运追踪罪人，义人却得善报。

sentences.english: At first a young boy, Manolin, had shared his bad fortune.
sentences.chinese: 最初，一个年轻的孩子曼诺林和他一起分担恶运。

sentences.english: The latest figures are seen by many to be harbingers of financial doom.
sentences.chinese: 许多人认为最新的数据是财政恶运的预兆。

sentences.english: After all this bad luck, it will probably take a turn for the better soon.
sentences.chinese: 在那么多恶运后，或许很快就会好转了。

sentences.english: Misfortunes tells us what fortune is.
sentences.chinese: 恶运临头后，方知幸运贵。

definition: variant of 厄運|厄运[e4 yun4]
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
fateful accident/inauspicious matter (involving death or casualties)
comet or supernova viewed as evil portent
a moldy smell/damp and rotten/fig. rotten bad luck
karmic hindrance (buddhism)/karmic consequences that stand in the way of enlightenment/(term of abuse, especially toward the younger generation) devil spawn/(fig.) money
